alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Guernsey; Monroe; Muskingum; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:21PM EDT until May 03 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR WESTERN GUERNSEY...NORTHWESTERN MONROE...SOUTHERN COSHOCTON... MUSKINGUM AND CENTRAL NOBLE COUNTIES... At 621 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Dresden to 9 miles south of New Concord, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, Coshocton, Cambridge, Caldwell, New Concord, Byesville, West Lafayette, South Zanesville, North Zanesville, Dresden, Philo, and Pleasant Grove. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
